Timothy Wall wrote:

> Probably a more useful test suite would be one that takes the names of
> the test methods to run as its ctor argument, then you can run arbitrary
> sets of them, e.g.
>
>    ArbitraryTestSuite extends TestSuite {
>       TestSuite(Class testCase, String[] cases) {
>         ...
>         }
> }
>
> Constructing test suites is really something better done dynamically or
> from a script, rather than hard-coded.
>

Agreed.  I've yet to see such an approach implemented, but I can envision it
working quite well.  JXUnit and Canoo WebTest are the closest I've seen to
running tests declared in an XML file.

I haven't tried this because, well... I run all the unit tests all the time.

Mike
